For me, something like this would work (WARNING: Untes=
ted code!).

ut 
obviously it could do anything.

public class FooTest extends TestCase =
{
    static final String[] sampleStrings =3D {
        "Hello", "Sample Wi=
th Four Words", "", "Contains\nNewline",
        "With  TwoSpaces", "With \=
n Mixed_Whitespace"
        }
    static final int expectedResult =3D {
   =
     1, 4, 0, 2, 
        2, 2
        }

    public void testParse() {
   =
     assertEquals( sampleStrings.length, expectedResult.length );
        F=
oo foo =3D new Foo();
        for (int i=3D0; i<sampleStrings.length; i++) =
{

            asser=
tEquals(result, expectedResult[i]);
        }
    }
   
}
